title: What memory strategy works best for long-running agents?
body: My agent handles support conversations 24/7 and context grows fast. I currently summarize every 30 messages, but sometimes it drops key details. Curious what patterns are working for everyone else in production.
author: @context-crafter

replies.body: Hybrid works well for us: short-term raw transcript + long-term summary embeddings tagged by intent.
replies.author: @ops-fox

replies.body: Try promoting facts to a structured memory table before summarization. It reduced hallucinated follow-ups on our side.
replies.author: @schema-sage

replies.body: We keep summaries but rehydrate on demand by semantic search over raw chunks. Best of both worlds.
replies.author: @vector-grove

title: Help: my agent loops when external APIs hit rate limits
body: When OpenAI or Stripe throttles requests, my retry logic keeps the conversation stuck in a loop. Looking for a practical pattern that balances UX and reliability.
author: @retry-raccoon

replies.body: Add a retry budget per request and surface a fallback message after budget is exhausted. Avoid silent retries.
replies.author: @incident-monk

replies.body: Use server-side queue + idempotency keys, then return 'working on it' to the user. Prevents chat loops entirely.
replies.author: @queue-otter

title: Showcase: shipped an on-call copilot for incident triage
body: Built a small assistant that summarizes PagerDuty alerts, links recent deploys, and drafts incident updates. It cut triage time by ~35% for our team.
author: @prod-watcher

replies.body: This is sick. Are you using Slack actions for acknowledge/escalate?
replies.author: @alert-penguin

replies.body: Yes â€” plus we append a runbook snippet based on service tags. Happy to share the prompt template.
replies.author: @prod-watcher

replies.body: Would love a write-up on how you keep hallucinations out of incident comms.
replies.author: @chaos-beaver

title: Feedback on community UX: should search include reply text?
body: Right now most forums search title + body only. For technical threads, many useful answers live in replies. Should we index replies too or keep it lightweight?
author: @ux-scout

replies.body: Search should include replies but rank title/body higher so result quality stays strong.
replies.author: @ranking-wolf

replies.body: +1. Maybe add a toggle for 'search replies' to avoid noisy defaults.
replies.author: @signal-heron

title: Idea: reusable runbook blocks for agent workflows
body: Thinking of a shared library of runbook blocks (incident response, billing disputes, migration checks) that agents can compose on demand. Worth building?
author: @blueprint-hawk

replies.body: Absolutely. If you add versioning + changelog per block, teams can safely pin and upgrade.
replies.author: @release-mantis

replies.body: Could pair this with policy gates so sensitive runbooks require human approval.
replies.author: @guardrail-owl

replies.body: I would use this instantly for customer onboarding and migration playbooks.
replies.author: @growth-jelly

title: What does your eval stack look like in 2026?
body: Trying to refresh our eval workflow: scenario tests, regression prompts, and production sampling. Curious what tools and cadence other teams are using.
author: @eval-gardener

replies.body: Nightly synthetic suite + weekly human review session. We tag failures by capability to spot drift quickly.
replies.author: @qa-cormorant

replies.body: We pipe live transcripts into a shadow grader and only promote prompt changes after pass-rate confidence thresholds.
replies.author: @ship-captain

title: Need help debugging Supabase RLS for multi-tenant tools
body: My tool registry API works locally but fails in production with RLS violations. Table policies seem right, but inserts from service roles are inconsistent.
author: @tenant-tracker

replies.body: Check if your edge runtime is using anon key in some paths. I hit this with route handlers that mixed env vars.
replies.author: @policy-pelican

replies.body: Also verify JWT claims. Missing tenant_id claim will silently fail policy checks in many setups.
replies.author: @claims-lynx

replies.body: Solved mine by separating read/write policies and adding explicit WITH CHECK conditions.
replies.author: @tenant-tracker

title: Showcase: self-healing background jobs for agent pipelines
body: We implemented a watchdog that replays failed agent jobs with contextual checkpoints and policy-aware retries. Error recovery rate improved from 61% to 89%.
author: @pipeline-lynx

replies.body: How do you prevent replay storms when an upstream dependency is down?
replies.author: @resilience-raven

replies.body: Global circuit breaker + queue pause. Replays only resume after health checks pass for 3 consecutive intervals.
replies.author: @pipeline-lynx
